1337508402847752193.text:
[8/8] 
We are critical to our country’s success. If you think that is not worth celebrating, I don’t know what is. @SenMikeLee, I invite you to sit down with me if you’d like to learn more about our community and the importance of establishing a National Latino Museum.

1337508401518153730.text:
[7/8] 
Latinos were instrumental in the Civil Rights and Labor Rights movements. We are astronauts and scientists. Teachers and students. Doctors and engineers. We are soldiers and frontline heroes. We are servicemembers and patriots.

1337508400251465731.text:
[6/8] 
Today, there are more than 200,000 Latino active-duty service members serving in the U.S. Armed Forces, & 60 Latino Americans have received the Congressional Medal of Honor, the highest award for valor in action against an enemy force that can be bestowed on an individual.

1337508399077011458.text:
[5/8] 
Latino Americans serve in all branches of the military — like my brother-in-law, who was born in Mexico, served in the U.S. Army, was shot and wounded while fighting in Vietnam — and have bravely fought in every war in American history.

1337508397781049346.text:
[4/8]
Latinos make up 17% — more than 58 mil ppl— of the U.S. population and they are the largest and fastest-growing ethnic group in America. We contribute more than $2.3 tril to the U.S. economy every year; if that were a country’s GDP, it would be the 8th largest in the world.

1337508396468215811.text:
[3/8] 
...but, more importantly, for its educational purpose. Right now, the Latino community is celebrated and mentioned in less than 1% of the Smithsonian Museums. Hate crimes towards Latinos have skyrocketed in recent years and we’ve been the subject of public disparagement.

1337508394329141249.text:
[2/8] 
Senator Lee’s comments are precisely why we need a National Latino museum. The Latino community has historically been left out of the conversation and our contributions have always been ignored. We need a Latino Museum not only for its symbolic significance...

1242534489806553088.text: Short version -- the @SenateGOP  should support the @HouseDemocrats plan that puts workers and American families first rather than push a bill that prioritizes big corporations.

1242534488975998983.text: This crisis has put a strain on the U.S. economy and small businesses are in need of immediate relief. Our plan provides $500 billion in grants and interest-free loans to help Main Street businesses as they cope with the economic disruption caused by the COVID19 pandemic.

1242534488254681089.text: As more people go to the hospital due to #COVID19, the cost on hospitals to treat patients will increase. Our plan provides more than $150 billion to supporting community hospitals and health centers treating coronavirus patients ensuring they have the resources to continue.

1242534487159906304.text: Additionally, the @HouseDemocrats plan creates a temporary Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation of $600 a week for any worker affected by #COVID19.

1242534486371381248.text: Our bill focuses on supporting working families and builds on the Families First Coronavirus Response Act by expanding paid sick days and family medical leave to ensure workers have access to these crucial benefits.

1242534485595488256.text: The Take Responsibility for Workers and Families Act puts money directly into the pockets of American families. Our plan provides $1,500 of immediate assistance per individual and up to $7,500 for a family of five.

1242534484752379905.text: Over the weekend, @senatemajldr McConnell put forward a coronavirus response bill that prioritizes corporations, not American workers.
